subject: Medicine
title: The Gut-Brain Connection
description: Learn The Gut-Brain Connection in one minute.

hook.text: Your gut has 500 million neurons and produces 95% of your serotonin. Your belly has its own brain.

buildup.text: The enteric nervous system in your gut communicates directly with your brain via the vagus nerve.

discovery.text: Gut bacteria produce neurotransmitters that influence mood, anxiety, and even decision-making.

twist.text: Transferring gut bacteria from anxious mice to calm ones makes the calm mice anxiousâ€”mood is partly in the gut.

climax.text: The gut-brain axis is now a major research frontier for treating depression and neurological diseases.

punchline.text: Trust your gutâ€”it's wired to your brain.

quiz.question: What surprising experiment showed the gut affects mood?
options: Transferring gut bacteria from anxious mice made calm mice anxious
Removing the vagus nerve eliminated all emotions
